channel.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
channel.description:
[url=https://github.com/Marwolf/Wolf-Kingdom]GitHub Project Repository[/url]
[url=http://wolfkingdom.net]Website and development forum[/url]
This project aims to rip all the best things from every other project and then build in a completely new direction. Think medieval DayZ zombie survivor with magic, clans, skilling, and no need to grind. Collect resources along the map, kill others over trivial amounts of loot, and build an empire of wealth while avoiding the dangerous undead and wild animals. Track down the bots and steal everything they have. Use your RSC skill to out play your rivals instead of grinding or paying to win. No subscription, no whining. Abuse everyone. Be ruthless. There is no government, only you.
The project includes all the needed tools to build new content. Everything operates in the NetBeans IDE. There is no Maven or Scala.
Work to do:
[ul][li]Enable group teleport portal ground object spell casting[/li] [li]Enable inhibit cast spell[/li] [li]Remove experience, set all players at 40 attack, 40 def, 40 str, 50 hits, 40 range, 40 magic[/li] [li]Wipe the landscape everywhere other than the wilderness[/li] [li]Begin building the port town of Mystenhaven near the greater demon house[/li] [li]Draw safe zones inside town borders[/li] [li]Auto drop randomly selected items from a table in different drop zones on timers for players to collect.[/li] [li]Disconnect from the PHPBB forum database user table[/li] [li]Build a better web player management interface[/li] [li]Rebuild the client updater[/li] [li]Truncate item loc, object loc and npc loc tables[/li] [li]Create multiple pet species using items[/li] [li]Create spell to release pet to attack other players[/li] [li]Create spell to capture wild animal NPCs[/li] [li]Allow pets to carry items for the player[/li] [li]Enable NPC vs pet combat[/li] [li]Set up a decent bug tracker[/li][/ul]

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:17, topic:548156”]I think it was related to fishing - players would become stuck and unable to walk.[/quote]Looks like it got fixed.

github.com/MoparClassic/MoparClassic

Issue: Fishing (Critical Bug)

opened by Rodgerwilco on 2013-09-10
closed by Lothy on 2015-12-17 
If you're alone... it's fine.
If two people fish one of them will get stuck.
What happened is player a and player b...

Read full topic

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:548156”][quote author=cleako link=topic=667064.msg4461741#msg4461741 date=1417888575]
I have heard complaints that the combat in Moparscape Classic compared to RSCD based servers is bad. Is there any credence to that statement? If there is no difference between them for PKing, then I may move from DarkQuest to MoparClassic for the game engine.
[/quote]
I’m not so sure about this one, but there was at least one game-breaking skilling bug that I don’t believe was fixed.[/quote]Is there an issue tracking it?

Read full topic

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @Hyperon Hyperon
item.description:
@Hyperon wrote:

Great project mate. Will be following you.

I also plan to have dropped items stay for a very long time. I imagine players roaming around discovering a trail of arrows. The player follows the arrows and comes across the death of a player. They could wait and hide and ambush the player or just come across some unclaimed items that help them survive.

It’s amazing how one simple aspect adds a whole new dimension of possibilities to the game.

Read full topic

cant wait to play

Read full topic

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I have heard complaints that the combat in Moparscape Classic compared to RSCD based servers is bad. Is there any credence to that statement? If there is no difference between them for PKing, then I may move from DarkQuest to MoparClassic for the game engine.

I’m not so sure about this one, but there was at least one game-breaking skilling bug that I don’t believe was fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Actually the java compiler will compute the value for you at compile time. So performance-wise, it doesn’t matter. You can test this yourself using a few programs included in the JDK.

class Test { public static void main(String[] args) { int i = 1000*60*60; System.out.println(i); } }

javac Test.java javap -c Test

[code=java]Compiled from “Test.java"
class Test {
Test();
Code:
0: aload_0
1: invokespecial #1 // Method java/lang/Object.”":()V
4: return

public static void main(java.lang.String[]);
Code:
0: ldc #2 // int 3600000
2: istore_1
3: getstatic #3 // Field java/lang/System.out:Ljava/io/PrintStream;
6: iload_1
7: invokevirtual #4 // Method java/io/PrintStream.println:(I)V
10: return
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

  • delayedEventHandler.add(new DelayedEvent(null, 14400000) { //removes ground items after 4 hours
  • delayedEventHandler.add(new DelayedEvent(null, 10006060) { //removes ground items after 60 minutes

the fuck didn’t you just do the math yourself?

Read full topic

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

public static void error(Object o) { if (o instanceof Exception) { Exception e = (Exception) o; e.printStackTrace(); System.exit(1); return;// Adding save data } System.err.println(o.toString()); }

lol

Read full topic

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @nacional nacional
item.description:
@nacional wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:3, topic:548156”][quote]
Game Government: No moderators, no oversight, and no rules. Play any way that works best.
[/quote]
Interesting line. I wonder if there’s a way for a regular version of the game to reward real players sufficiently so that botting doesn’t matter.
For example, you could bot and get 20k experience per hour in a skill, or you could do some other method that would require intrinsically human traits to get 200k experience per hour and far more resources.

Anyway, the game idea sounds interesting in its own right.[/quote]
I think this is what Jagex try to do by having pest control and clay something.
But bots eventually caught on. Of course it can be manange easier on private servers
though due to smaller pop size.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Game Government: No moderators, no oversight, and no rules. Play any way that works best.
Interesting line. I wonder if there's a way for a regular version of the game to reward real players sufficiently so that botting doesn't matter. For example, you could bot and get 20k experience per hour in a skill, or you could do some other method that would require intrinsically human traits to get 200k experience per hour and far more resources.

Anyway, the game idea sounds interesting in its own right.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolf Kingdom Development
item.dc:creator: @Native_Method Native Method
item.description:
@Native_Method wrote:

If helpful I can link you a much much better 2d/3d AIO map editor. Although you will have to wait for me to get my desktop mac from my old house.

Also, the released 3d one written in C++ is pretty decent, although lacks the ability to add rooves.

Read full topic
